section.name: JCS Package Information
section.p: The following tables provide a brief description of all packages in the Java Caching System. For brevity, org.apache.stratum.jcs has been abbreviated to o.a.s.j.

subsection.name: Access
subsection.p: These packages house the classes that a user of JCS should need to access the cache.

tr.td: Root package of JCS. Currently this package only contains the class JCS which provides a simple interface for clients to use JCS.
Contains classes for accessing the cache. The CacheAccess interface, which all classes in this package implement, provides all the methods a client should need to use a Cache.

subsection.name: Configuration
subsection.p: This package contains the cache configuration code.

tr.td: This package contains utility classes that are used when configuring the cache. NOTE: It is likely that these classes will be removed in the future in favor of the configuration code in stratum and BeanUtils.

subsection.name: Engine
subsection.p: These packages contain the code for the core of the cache: core interfaces, queues, and the cache hub.

tr.td: Interfaces used by the core and the auxiliary caches.
Interfaces used by the core and the auxiliary caches.
The primary cache classes and the hub.
The group cache code. Some classes here should be under control.
Parent package for memory type plugins.
The primary memory plugin using a 'least recently used' removal policy.
A memory plugin implemented using a 'most recently used' removal policy. In general this is slow and should not be used.

subsection.name: Auxiliary Caches
subsection.p: Auxiliary caches generally fall into 3 types: disk, lateral, and remote. Additional auxiliaries should be put into the appropriate parent package.

tr.td: The primary disk auxiliary. Objects are serialized to a file on disk. This implementation uses memory keys and performs quite well. Recomended for most cases.
Disk cache implemented with the Java Indexed Serialization Package, which allows serialization of objects to B-Tree indexed tables on disk. This is quite slow currently.
A disk cache using Hypersonic SQL to serialize the contained objects.
Root package for the lateral cache family. Lateral caches broadcast puts and removals to other local caches. See this explanation for more information.
Root package for the remote auxiliary cache. See this explanation of the remote cache for more information.

subsection.name: Utilities
subsection.p: These packages contain utility classes used by JCS. Many can eventually be converted to commons utilities.

tr.td: Contains a file with constants used by the utils.servlet package. Will be removed.
Implementation of a read write lock which maintains FIFO ordering for write lock requests, but no ordering for read lock requests.
Contains a thread pool implementation, some of which is originally from Tomcat.
